source_sentence: 佛說寶藏神大明曼拏羅儀軌經
translation: Foshuo baozangshen daming mannaluo yigui jing
second part of the volume

source_sentence: 西天譯經三藏朝散大夫試鴻臚少卿
translation: Tripiṭaka of the Western Translation of the Sutra of the Buddha, Tathāgata, and Young Secretary of the Court

source_sentence: 傳教大師臣法天奉　詔譯
translation: Translated by imperial order of the Minister Fetian, the Master of the Transmission of the Teachings
The following are the true sayings of the various schools.

source_sentence: 請召發遣供獻加持並皆通用。
translation: "Calling, sending, offering, and maintaining are all universal.

source_sentence: 阿難哆鉢納摩(二合引)野娑嚩(二合引)賀(引)此是蓮花寶藏真言。
translation: This is the true saying for the lotus-flower treasure house.

source_sentence: 阿難哆商佉(引)野娑嚩(二合引)賀(引)此是硨磲寶藏真言。
translation: Ānanda shōkha (citation needed) and sahāva (dichotomy cited) are the words of the treasure house of the coral tree.

source_sentence: 囉惹曩(引)婆(引)野馱曩(引)地鉢哆曳娑嚩(二合引)賀(引)此是囉惹哆曩婆夜叉王真言。
translation: Rājagṛha(citation needed), Dīpaṃdhara(citation needed), and Dharma King(citation needed), this is the True Saying of Rājagṛha(citation needed), the king of the nightjars.

source_sentence: 摩尼曩(引)婆(引)野(引)馱曩(引)地鉢哆曳娑嚩(二合引)賀(引)此是囉怛曩(二合)曩(引)婆夜叉王真言。
translation: This is the true teaching of Rājagatana-nāga-rāja-rāja (cited).

source_sentence: 酥曩(引)婆(引)野馱曩(引)地鉢哆曳(引)娑嚩(二合引)賀此是酥曩(引)婆夜叉王真言。
translation: This is the true teaching of King Gṛdhrakūṭa, the (quoted) Śubhakūṭa (quoted) Śubhakūṭa (quoted) Śākyamuni, the (quoted) Śubhakūṭa king.

source_sentence: 暗婆曩(引)婆(引)野馱曩(引)地鉢哆曳(引)娑嚩(二合引)賀此是暗婆曩(引)婆夜叉王真言。
translation: "This is the true teaching of the king of the night-sharks, Kumbhâṇḍa.

source_sentence: 儞囉曩(引)婆(引)野馱曩(引)地鉢哆曳(引)娑嚩(二合引)賀此是羅曩婆夜叉王真言。
translation: This is the true teaching of King Rāhula-vāda (cited), the king of the nightjars.

source_sentence: 吠室囉(二合)摩拏也(二合)野馱曩(引)地鉢哆曳(引)娑嚩(二合引)賀此是毘沙門夜叉王真言。
translation: This is the true teaching of Vaiśravaṇa, the king of the nightjars.

source_sentence: 摩賀(引)曩(引)婆(引)野馱曩(引)地鉢哆曳(引)娑嚩(二合)賀此是摩賀(引)曩(引)婆夜叉王真言。
translation: This is the true teaching of Mahātejas garuḍêndra, the king of the nightjars.

source_sentence: 賀囉惹敢(二合)婆迦吽頗吒娑嚩(二合)賀此是賀囉惹敢(二合)婆夜叉王真言。
translation: This is the true saying of the king of the night-sharks, Harājagṛha (dichotomy) and Bhārgava (dichotomy).

source_sentence: 惹敢(二合)婆迦野羼捺囉(二合)野娑嚩(二合)賀此是惹敢(二合)婆迦夜叉王真言。
translation: This is the true saying of the king of the nightjars, Jāṅgālā-bhārgava-jārgava-jārgava-jārgava-jārgava.

source_sentence: 護努護努喃曩(引)酥細拏也(二合)野娑嚩(二合)賀此是酥細拏夜叉王真言。
translation: This is the true chant of the king of the nightshades, Jātī-rāja.

source_sentence: 賀囉賀囉贊捺囉(二合)細(引)曩(引)野娑嚩(二合引)賀此是贊捺囉(二合)細(引)曩夜叉王真言。
translation: This is the true teaching of the king of the nightshades who praises the fine (cited) nature of the nightshade.

source_sentence: 惹婆曩(引)野娑嚩(二合)賀
translation: Javanān(cited) Sadvāsāṃghā
"This is the true teaching to guard and moisten.
"If he were to guard and moisten his body, he would use the words apasmāraṅga-ścai.
Use the wet wood from the Aparamālaga tree.
Use butter and honey to wet this firewood.
Observe the precepts for one day and night.
He makes 8,000 guardians.
They'll attain great wisdom.

source_sentence: 能令誦人日記一千頌永不忘失。
translation: It'll cause reciters to memorize a thousand verses a day and never forget them.

source_sentence: 若以阿里迦木根作寶藏神相。
translation: Suppose he were to use the woody root of the arica tree to create the treasury deity's form.
It could be six fingers long and up.
He'll wear a crown of gods on his head and be adorned in various ways.
He'll be worshipped with flowers and incense.
Then, he'll use firewood made from the wet wood of Aparamālīnga.
He sifts it in butter and honey.
He makes a guard of fire for a lakṣa.
Every day, he'll get a hundred coins of silver.
Again, he spoke the true words of the treasure house spirit mind.

source_sentence: 曩謨(引)囉怛曩(二合)怛囉(二合)夜(引)野曩謨(引)摩(引)尼婆捺囉(二合引)野摩賀(引)藥乞叉(二合)細(引)曩(引)鉢哆曳(引)酥(引)嚩(引)酥(引)尾訖里(二合引)尼野彌里致娑嚩(二合引)賀此寶藏神心真言。
translation: "This is the true saying of the treasured spirit, 'Mo (citation) rātanā (btn) rātanā (btn) yai (citation) yo (citation) mo (citation) nivādarā (btn) yo (citation) mo he (citation) yakṣa ki (btn) sech (citation) mo (citation) yo (citation) pada (citation) ghee (citation) mo (citation) ghee (citation) wikeri (btn) niyamiri to sah (btn) ghee.
It's capable of achieving the highest level of accomplishment.

source_sentence: 若入水至膝作水護摩誦此真言能獲財利又若以儞淫(二合)摩木。
translation: If he enters water up to his knees and makes it a water protector, chanting this true chant will bring wealth and profit.
It can be used to grow four commands and level the playing field.

source_sentence: 持戒畫人畫寶賢相莊嚴具足。
translation: Observing the precepts, he paints a picture of a man with a jeweled, virtuous face that's adorned and complete.
After offering food and drink, he presents it to them.
Three times a day, he uses a flame.
It's a fire with lots of smoke and few flames.
He makes a purple ore fire that protects 8,000.
He'll be able to subdue a great wealthy man.

source_sentence: 復說別夜叉王心真言文句用圓。
translation: He also explains that the text and phrases of the true words of the special king of the yakṣas use the perfect.
It's also capable of bringing about the most excellent accomplishment.

source_sentence: 囉怛曩(二合)婆捺囉(二合)哆帝三摩野摩努瑟摩(二合)囉摩尼婆捺囉(二合)野婆誐嚩覩(引)夜(引)唧哆娑覩(二合)馱摩馱摩摩(引)唧囉摩賀(引)藥乞叉(二合)細(引)曩(引)必隣(二合)哆覩嚕覩嚕摩(引)尼婆捺囉(二合)覩嚕覩嚕摩(引)尼婆捺囉(二合)俱致俱致摩(引)尼婆捺囉(二合)覩致覩致摩(引)尼婆捺囉(二合)帝致帝致摩尼婆捺囉(二合)娑嚩(二合引)賀復有壇法不揀吉星曜日。
translation: 囉怛曩(二合)婆捺囉(二合)哆帝三摩野摩努瑟摩(二合)囉摩尼婆捺囉(二合)野婆誐嚩覩(引)夜(引)唧哆娑覩(二合)馱摩馱摩摩(引)唧囉摩賀(引)藥乞叉(二合)細(引)曩(引)必隣(二合)哆覩嚕覩嚕摩(引)尼婆捺囉(二合)覩嚕覩嚕摩(引)尼婆捺囉(二合)俱致俱致摩(引)尼婆捺囉(二合)覩致覩致摩(引)尼婆捺囉(二合)帝致帝致摩尼婆捺囉(二合)娑嚩(二合引)賀復有壇法不揀吉星曜日。
Nor does it pretend to be a person who observes the precepts.

source_sentence: 但用阿里迦木或儞淫(二合)摩木及別樹木作寶賢相。
translation: They simply use arjaka wood, nipa wood, or some other tree to make a jeweled image of Bhadrayān.
He makes offerings with flowers and incense.
Use white mustard-seed and vegetable oil on the middle of the day.
Rub it on the body of the Ratnaketu image.
He recites the preceding true verse a hundred thousand times.
Each day, he'll get eight coins.
After you get it, you must make sure you use it up.
Don't leave a single coin behind, and do so day by day.
The Baosang spirit then explained the ritual for reciting the true chant.

source_sentence: 令持誦者先自乞食持齋。
translation: He tells the person reciting it to first solicit alms and observe purification.
He recites the fundamental true chant, Sanrokṣa.

source_sentence: 然後於如來前設大供獻。
translation: Then, he makes a big offering in front of the Tathāgata.
Reciting the 8,000 true words will bring much wealth.

source_sentence: 次明水護摩每日以手掬水。
translation: Next, he explains that the water protector scoops up water with his hands every day.
He then dumps it into the water.
It's like this, up to a hundred or a thousand grains.
He extends an offering to the good and noble.

source_sentence: 如是至六箇月能得大財。
translation: Up to six months in this way, he'll attain great wealth.

source_sentence: 次說入大曼拏羅諸部灌頂真言。
translation: Next, he says, "Enter the consecration of the great maṇḍala schools with the following dhāraṇī.

source_sentence: 惹敢(二合)婆曩吒謨吒迦(引)野娑嚩(二合引)賀此是謨吒迦夜叉女真言。
translation: "This is the true saying of Moṭaka, the goddess of the night, which is cited in Jagatha (btn.) Vāanṣaṭha.

source_sentence: 囉訖哆(二合)即以(二合)賀嚩(二合)娑嚩(二合引)賀此是囉訖哆[口*爾]嚩夜叉女真言。
translation: This is the true teaching of Rāketa [muzzle*er]vajra for a female yakṣa.

source_sentence: 摩護(引)那囉(引)野娑嚩(二合引)賀此是摩護那羅夜叉女真言。
translation: This is the true teaching of Māhuṇḍarā-saṃvara, the night-sharkess.

translation: This is the true teaching of the female Vimalakīrti yakṣa who praises the virtues of the Vimalakīrti yakṣa.

translation: This is the mantra for the goddess Śikhin (cited), Śākya (cited), Śākya (cited), and Pārijāta (cited).

source_sentence: 印捺囉(二合引)野禰(引)嚩(引)地鉢哆野娑嚩(二合)賀此是帝釋心真言。

source_sentence: 阿誐曩(二合引)曳(引)賀尾也(二合)地鉢多曳(引)娑嚩(二合)賀此是火天真言。
translation: This is the true chant of the fire deity, Aga-nāga-rāja (partially cited), Va-ti-ptah-no-saṃsāra (partially cited), and Va-ti-ptah-no-saṃsāra (partially cited).

source_sentence: 夜摩(引)野必里(二合引)哆(引)地鉢哆曳(引)娑嚩(二合引)賀此是夜摩天心真言。
translation: Yama(citation needed) Nopiri(citation needed) Dharma(citation needed) Dharma(citation needed) Dharma(citation needed) Saṃbha(dichotomy) He This is the true teaching of the mind of the Yama Heaven.

source_sentence: 乃(引)里怛也(二合)曳(引)洛乞叉(二合)娑(引)地鉢哆曳(引)娑嚩(二合)賀此是乃乙里帝心真言。
translation: This is the true chant of the mind of Nādika Nairaṭanya (btn), trailing (citing) Lokikṣa (btn), Sa (citing) Dipatthā Trailing (citing), and Sa (btn) He.

source_sentence: 嚩嚕拏也(二合)野惹羅(引)地鉢哆曳(引)娑嚩(二合引)賀此是水天心真言。
translation: This is the true chant of the mind of the Water God, Varuṇa, Nāgârjuna, and Bhadra.

source_sentence: 嚩(引)野尾(引)按哆里乞叉(二合引)地鉢哆曳(引)娑嚩(二合引)賀此是風天心真言。
translation: This is the true saying for the mind of the Wind God, Va(citation needed) Noe(citation needed) Jibalikṣa(citation needed) Sa(citation needed) Va(citation needed).

source_sentence: 俱尾(引)囉(引)野馱曩鉢哆曳(引)娑嚩(二合引)賀此是俱尾羅心真言。
translation: This is the true chant of the mind of Kubla.

source_sentence: 伊舍曩(引)野馱曩(引)地鉢哆曳(引)娑嚩(二合引)賀此是伊舍曩天心真言。
translation: This is the true chant of the mind of Īśānara, the god Śārdhânara.

source_sentence: 惹里馱(二合)沒囉(二合)憾摩(二合)尼所(二合)娑嚩(二合引)賀此是大梵天心真言。
translation: This is the true chant of the mind of the Brahma Heaven, Jāritī (btn) bhrā (btn) dharma (btn) nisho (btn) svāh (btn) hā.

source_sentence: 阿冒(引)尾瑟拏(二合)吠(引)娑嚩(二合引)賀此是那羅延天心真言。
translation: Ābhāsvara-vaiḍūrya-saṃvara is a true chant from the mind of the Nārāyaṇa Heaven.

source_sentence: 阿儞嚩里哆(二合)曩(引)野娑嚩(二合引)賀此是金剛心真言。
translation: Ābhidharma-vṛddha-anāthapiṇḍada-saṃsāṃghârāma is the true chant of the mind of Vajrāṇasena.

source_sentence: 賀囉(二合)哆(引)娑曩(引)野娑嚩(二合引)賀此是槊心真言。
translation: This is the true chant for the long-lasting Buddha's mind.

source_sentence: 摩賀(引)寫(引)摩(引)野娑嚩(二合引)賀此是杖心真言。
translation: This is the true saying for the heart of the staff.

source_sentence: 佉陵誐(二合)尾摩羅馱(引)里尼娑嚩(二合引)賀此是劍心真言。
translation: "This is the true chant for the heart of the sword.

source_sentence: 嚩嚕拏嚩摩(引)野娑嚩(二合引)賀此是羂索心真言。
translation: "This is the true chant for the mind of the lasso.

source_sentence: 鉢囉(二合)普敢(二合)惹曩野娑嚩(二合引)賀此是幢心真言。
translation: This is the true chant of the banner-like mind.

source_sentence: 摩賀(引)燥(引)摩也(二合)囉娑摩曳娑嚩(二合引)賀此是輪心真言。
translation: This is the true chant for the wheel of the Dharma mind.

source_sentence: 左(引)隷(引)閉孕(二合)誐隷(引)娑嚩(二合引)賀此是三股叉心真言。
translation: This is the true chant for the mind of the three-pronged forks.
It's used together with the precepts for the restraints.

source_sentence: 娑囉捺(引)野娑嚩(二合引)賀
translation: Śālavana (cited), Śālavana (cited), and Śāriputra (cited).
This is the true saying for the bow and arrow.

translation: Om (citation) Jaleedhar (b.h.) Jaluo (muzzle) Ro (b.h.) Semi Jaluo (citation) No Sa (b.h.) He This is the true chant of Vajragarbha.

They use this vial of goodness to give consecration.

Suppose he enters the great maṇḍala.
They will wholeheartedly follow the law and sincerely consecrate it.
They'll also be able to see the treasured store deity.
Three times, he teaches and permits the mastery of the great seal.

source_sentence: 復作護摩以二十種物作廣大供獻。
translation: He also makes a vast offering of twenty different things as a guard and moat.

source_sentence: 誦聖天及大夜叉王本尊真言。
translation: He recites the true sayings of the principal deities of the holy gods and the great king of the yakṣas.
Three times a day, he makes offerings according to his strength.

source_sentence: 得三昧真言最上成就為自擁護。
translation: He attains the highest accomplishment of the true words of samādhi and protects himself.

source_sentence: 佛言我今復說所作精熟最上印法及真言句。
translation: The Buddha said, "Now, I'll again explain the most accomplished seal methods and the phrases of the true sayings that I've refined.
It was then that the great king of the yakṣas and so forth.
Their hearts yearned for the Buddha to preach them.
The Bhagavān then looked around the assembly.
He made a lion's roar and told them.
"All of you, listen closely! Listen closely!

source_sentence: 今此寶藏神真言印法具大慈悲。
translation: This is the true speech seal of the treasured store spirit that's imbued with great compassion.
It's capable of disciplining those who are difficult to subdue.

source_sentence: 與一切眾生成就一切勝利之事。
translation: It creates all kinds of excellent things with all sentient beings.'
The king of the yakṣas and the others knelt on their right knees.
They bowed their palms to the Buddha and listened quietly.
It was then that the Bhagavān addressed them.

source_sentence: 如大師子自在無畏說真言印。
translation: He spoke the seal of true speech like the great teacher Amitâbha with sovereignty and fearlessness.
He put his two hands flat on top of each other with his palms together.
He interlocked his two middle fingers.
He spreads his two ring fingers like needles.
He bends the third knuckle.
He attaches his two head fingers to his ring finger.
The big finger follows the first finger.
The two pinkies are like needles.
This is the mudrā of the treasured spirit's root.
He binds this seal in the middle.
He'll attain the manifestation of the treasured store spirit.
He observes the person who recites it and attains the accomplishment of his vows of giving.
He recites this true chant.

source_sentence: 次作左隣捺囉夜叉王印。

He recites this true chant.

source_sentence: 合掌舉手三雙指屈第三節。
translation: He joins his palms, raises his three pairs of fingers, and bends the third knuckle.

source_sentence: 中指磔開大指各各相離。
